name: places/ChIJG7kH9adZwokRU5FCsvyarIk
adrFormatAddress: 860 7th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: I don’t get a lot of free time and don’t have a lot of money lying around so I thought let me treat myself to a manicure not by myself for once. The two stars are because the base coat was cleanly polished and my cuticles didn’t bleed. But there is something wrong with every single one of my nails. The designs, the simple designs are crooked, not symmetric with both hands, the black polish is not filled in and looks streaky when i look at my nails, and several of my nails are almond shaped and crooked or noticeable longer than the other hand. If I wanted something that looks like an amateur drew on I would’ve done it at home. When we go out and PAY for a service, we pay for something better than what we could do at home. We do not pay for all of the above plus an argumentative tech who doesn’t want to redo a simple retro moon half circle at the cuticle when asked once or who takes it upon herself to keep redoing a design without being asked and still manages to have it come out badly. The only reason I left with something is because I have a job interview. I would not have tipped 15% let alone the 20% they “conveniently” add in for you.  I cannot wait to get these off my hands somewhere else.

originalText.text: Went for a gel manicure and pedicure with regular polish and I loved it! Alina was my nail technician and she was amazing. Super precise and did a wonderful job with my nails! So if you book ask for Alina, she’s the best!

text.text: Went for a gel manicure and pedicure with regular polish and I loved it! Alina was my nail technician and she was amazing. Super precise and did a wonderful job with my nails! So if you book ask for Alina, she’s the best!

originalText.text: I’ve never been so incensed about a salon experience. I came to get a gel x removal (20 minute time quote) and a regular manicure (20 minutes). The woman who did my nails so aggressively removed the gel x that she caused me to bleed. She then didn’t get all of the gel x off. After a full hour of her grating at my nails - the pain was too much and I had to tell her to stop without having any other work done of my nails - including the manicure i booked. I now have to book another appointment elsewhere to get the rest of the gel x removed and can’t get any polish done now that they cut my fingers. Just hoping now I don’t get an infection from the process. See below for how my nails looked right after I left the salon

originalText.text:
I would give Glosslab 4 stars to reflect the mix of experiences - I once had a 2 star nail tech, but for the most part it is 4-5 stars (Ask for Alina - she did a great job!) Glosslab is nice for the convenience (easy booking), cleanliness, and locations across New York.
I have their monthly duo membership which is 2 manicures (including gel) for $85 plus 20% automatic gratuity. It is best if you get your nails done with some regularity. Their gel removal is best for their own polish though, and it takes forever if you are using another brand polish unfortunately.

text.text:
I would give Glosslab 4 stars to reflect the mix of experiences - I once had a 2 star nail tech, but for the most part it is 4-5 stars (Ask for Alina - she did a great job!) Glosslab is nice for the convenience (easy booking), cleanliness, and locations across New York.
I have their monthly duo membership which is 2 manicures (including gel) for $85 plus 20% automatic gratuity. It is best if you get your nails done with some regularity. Their gel removal is best for their own polish though, and it takes forever if you are using another brand polish unfortunately.

originalText.text: My review is for the customer service. Very sweet staff. It was my first time with glosslab and while the atmosphere was nice the music was too loud for me personally. My nail tech did not seem very experienced in manicures period. I left with what looks like I could do at home. Nails barely filed to correct shape although short . Cuticles not clean. Polish on skin not cleaned. Offered lotion but barely put any on with half hazard massage. It felt try and scratchy. I didn’t feel my hand was properly cleaned from the little filing. The nail polish seemed old. Application was streaky. When she applied the top coat she messed up the color because it wasn’t dry. That’s ok. Then she had to do it again because there was traces of a red polish in the clear top coat. It wasn’t clear if she was using a brand new tools set as I didn’t see her rip it open just take it out of a bag. Sweet staff but I don’t think I’ll return.
